author: aqeeliz
message:
That's a nice feature. It should save me lots of time when importing newly taken photos and deciding which one of those similar looking photos should be kept and which one should be discarded. Usually, I just press back and next button few times to decide which one looks better or open another instance of Gwenview.

Oh, and cute kids!

replies.author: mutlu
replies.message: Yes, great feature! Never thought about this, but it will save me quite some time. :)

author: Beojan Stanislaus
message: How about a blink comparator feature as part of the compare mode

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Thanks for the link. I don't think it fits Gwenview use case though: from what I understand a blink comparator is useful to highlight differences between two very similar images whereas in the case of comparing pictures there will most likely be lots of differences due to movements of the camera or of the subject, different camera settings. I don't think it would make sense to "diff" the image.

author: Emil Sedgh
message:
Hi Aurélien.

Last week i noticed that svg kpart renders very poorly comparing to khtml and/or webkit.
May i ask why its not being removed? Please note that it also acts as default kpart for viewing svg files and gives a very poor user experience because users will just think kde/konqueror couldnt show svg's properly.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Good question. I must confess I do not actively work on it, it's basically in maintenance mode. It was created because at that time Gwenview used KParts and needed a way to render SVG. It does not use KPart anymore, but I kept SVG Part alive on the basis that it was useful for Konqueror. If Konqueror does a better job at rendering SVG, then maybe SVG Part can go now.

author: prostosuper
message:
Just wanted to thank you for awesome image viewer. Thank you!
I love it so much!
